com.totsp.gwittir.client.util
Class WindowContext

java.lang.Object
  com.totsp.gwittir.client.util.WindowContext

public class WindowContext
extends java.lang.Object

The WindowContext class is a front end for abstract client storage, allowing for the storage of key/value pairs that persist on the client between browser sessions. It is built on top of the other persistence systems in the client.util package and fails down (with availablility from Gears to MSIE UserData, to FireFox/Opera DOMStorage (and in the future to Flash LSO).

Author:
Robert "kebernet" Cooper

Field Detail

INSTANCE

public static final WindowContext INSTANCE
The static instance of the WindowContext object.

Method Detail

flush

public void flush()
Immediately writes the values in the context to whatever the persistent store is. This will happen automatically during onWindowClosing(); Final storage may or may not be synchronous to the call of the flush() method.

initialize

public void initialize(WindowContext.WindowContextCallback callback)
Initializes the WindowContext. Takes in a call back that will be notified when the initialization procedure is complete. This will *always* take place off the execution context of the call to initialize, whether the individual persistence mechanism is asynchronous or not. Calls to initialize after the first will be ignored.

Parameters:
callback - WindowContextCallback to notify when the WindowContext has been initialized.

get

public java.lang.String get(java.lang.String key)
Gets the value of a key

Parameters:
key - The key value to lookup
Returns:
a value or null

put

public void put(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.String item)
Inserts a new value into the dataset

Parameters:
key - the key to insert. Keys should contain ONLY alphanumeric characters.
item - the new value to insert.
